1.name: The Button Room
1.intro: The room simply has a table with four buttons: red, yellow, green, and blue. There is no context whatsoever, but the way to solve the puzzle is to press the four buttons in the correct order. There are a total of four hints, one to correspond to each button. Each person is handed a hint, but not all of the hints are true. They are all hidden within the room, but not without a catch. Beside the table, there is a box with a few items to assist with solving the puzzle.

action.npc2: %NPC2% is pacing back and forth the room.

clue.clue1: The color of human blood should go first.
clue.clue2: The lucky color of the day should go first.
clue.clue3: The color of plants should go last.
clue.clue4: The color of water should go after the lucky color.
clue.clue5: The color of wealth should go before the color of plants.
clue.clue6: The golden button is a key to one survival.

kill.player: You get stuck on the spot and realize that you can't move. The door is right in front of you, and everyone else had already gone through, leaving you behind. The door closes, and a block comes from the ceiling and crushes your body from top to bottom, effectively ending your life.
kill.npc: NPC tries to walk but is unable to due to being paralyzed on the spot. The door is open, and everyone else is rushing out. The door closes with you looking back, bewildered that someone was left behind. As the door closes, a crushing sound can be heard from behind.

1.conclusion: Everyone is silent in the next room as they processed what happened. Someone had just died, and everyone is now more wary than ever of their future actions.

2.name: The Lab
2.intro: The room mimics a science lab with random samples of unknown liquids stored in vials and beakers littered around the room. There are four rows of lab tables, and cabinets are aligned on all four walls in the room. Typical lab tools such as Bunsen burners, testing tubes, tweezers, etc. are present as well. The room is lit with artificial white light.

action.npc2: %NPC2% is examining liquids in the room.
action.npc3: %NPC3% is poking at the lock with a glass stick.

clue.clue1: Always add acid to water and never water to acid.
clue.clue2: A sample of distilled water is stored in a cabinet.
clue.clue3: The key to the cabinet can be fished out from a sample of sulfuric acid.
clue.clue4: Hydrochloric acid is your best friend.

kill.player: You suddenly feel a pour of unknown liquid splash on you and hear a click. You feel your body burning as you realize that your body has been set on fire.
kill.npc: As you are all walking out of the room, you hear a splash from behind and notice that NPC has been doused in an unknown liquid and lit on fire. You and the others watch, horrified, as the body burns away and a stench fills the air.

2.conclusion: Unable to watch any further, you all turn away and face forwards, leaving the door behind you to shut on its own as you enter the next room.

3.name: The Room of Justice
3.intro: The room has worn-out walls and dimmed lighting. There is a guillotine in the center of the room along with a message scratched on the wall: 'Will justice be served?' and a box next to the guillotine saying to draw a slip with a number on it. There are four puppets in the room along the wall that mimic the remaining playersâ€™ appearances. Whoever is found guilty in the room has their puppet sent to the guillotine for their head to be chopped off. Lying is not allowed. At the end, whoever has lied the most gets killed by a hidden blade from the side that slices through their neck.

action.npc1: %NPC1% is inspecting the guillotine and stroking the side of the blade.
action.npc2: %NPC2% is drawing patterns on the floor with their finger.
action.npc3: %NPC3% is leaning against a wall with their arms crossed and eyes closed.

clue.clue1: Whoever has the lowest number deserves to die.
clue.clue2: Send in the guilty one for execution.

kill.player: As you are walking towards the door to the next room, you briefly hear something from the side before a blade slices the air from the side, chopping your neck off and effectively killing you.
kill.npc: As everyone is walking towards the next room, a scream is heard from behind and you see NPC's head being sliced by a blade that flew out from the side.

3.conclusion: It seemed that you were the only one who had noticed, or maybe it's because everyone else is ignoring what's happening, but you all proceed into the next room eventually.

4.name: The Trap Room
4.intro: The room is a trap room. Spikes align the walls, and the floor is tiled. Each tile on the floor can be lifted in some way if some condition is fulfilled. One misstep could mean instant death for all, as some tiles can potentially drop at any time. A message says you need to activate three traps to proceed. If you are lucky, you live, and if not, you die.

action.npc1: %NPC1% is examining the spikes on the wall.
action.npc2: %NPC2% is muttering something incomprehensible while intensely eyeing the tiles on the floor.

clue.clue1: Reveal the path and you shall be free.
clue.clue2: A noble sacrifice shall be chosen.

kill.player: The noble sacrifice is seen falling and screaming as they fall through one of the tiles into an endless pit of darkness.
kill.npc: You have been chosen to be the noble sacrifice. The ground beneath you disappears, and you feel yourself fallingrapidly into an endless pit of darkness.

4.conclusion: There is no turning back as only two people remain, including you. The next room will most likely end things once and for all.

5.name: The Dilemma Room
5.intro: The room is a gas chamber. There is a timer above the exit door with the remaining time left in the room until the gas releases. Once the gas is released, there will be another countdown for opening the door to the exit.

kill.player: Deciding to circumvent the trust system was a mistake on your part. You find yourself in an invisible chokehold and suspended midair, unable to breathe. Gas rapidly flows through the chamber, putting you through a slow and painful death.
kill.npc: %NPC1% had circumvented the trust system, having lied to you during the trust process. They are placed in an invisible chokehold and suspended midair, unable to breathe. Gas rapidly flows through the chamber, putting %NPC1% through a slow and painful death.

5.conclusion: You have survived the entire ordeal and made it out alive, even if it meant sacrificing people along the way. Congratulations on the difficult feat, and best of luck on the road ahead.
